briefdescription.para: firewireWinDCAM.cpp This is areaDetector driver support for firewire cameras that comply with the IIDC DCAM protocol.

detaileddescription.para: This implements the FirewireWinDCAM class which inherits from the areaDetector ADDriver class.
The driver uses the 1394Camera library from Carnegie-Mellon University
Created: March 2009 Convenience macro to be used inside the firewireDCAM class.

briefdescription.para: Specific asyn commands for this support module.

detaileddescription.para: These will be used and managed by the parameter library (part of areaDetector).

briefdescription.para: Number of asyn parameters (asyn commands) this driver supports.
Only used for debugging/error messages to identify where the message comes from.

memberdef.name: errMsg
memberdef.initializer: = { "Success", "Generic error", "Unknown error", "Unknown error", "Unknown error", "Unknown error", "Unknown error", "Unknown error", "Unknown error", "Unknown error", "Unsupported", "Not initialized", "Invalid video settings", "Busy", "Insufficient resources", "Param out of range", "Frame timeout", }

memberdef.name: videoModeStrings
featureIndex
memberdef.initializer: = { FEATURE_BRIGHTNESS, FEATURE_AUTO_EXPOSURE, FEATURE_SHARPNESS, FEATURE_WHITE_BALANCE, FEATURE_HUE, FEATURE_SATURATION, FEATURE_GAMMA, FEATURE_SHUTTER, FEATURE_GAIN, FEATURE_IRIS, FEATURE_FOCUS, FEATURE_TEMPERATURE, FEATURE_TRIGGER_MODE, FEATURE_TRIGGER_DELAY, FEATURE_WHITE_SHADING, FEATURE_FRAME_RATE, FEATURE_ZOOM, FEATURE_PAN, FEATURE_TILT, FEATURE_OPTICAL_FILTER, FEATURE_CAPTURE_SIZE, FEATURE_CAPTURE_QUALITY }

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *portName, const char *camid, int maxBuffers, size_t maxMemory, int priority, int stackSize)
memberdef.name: WinFDC_Config

briefdescription.para: Configuration function to configure one camera.

detaileddescription.para:
This function need to be called once for each camera to be used by the IOC. A call to this function instanciates one object from the FirewireWinDCAM class.
portName
Asyn port name to assign to the camera.
camid
The camera ID or serial number in a hexadecimal string. Lower case and upper case letters can be used. This is used to identify a specific camera on the bus. For instance: "0x00b09d01007139d0". If this parameter is empty ("") then the first camera found on the Firewire bus will be used.
maxBuffers
Maxiumum number of NDArray objects (image buffers) this driver is allowed to allocate. This driver requires 2 buffers, and each queue element in a plugin can require one buffer which will all need to be added up in this parameter. Use -1 for unlimited.
maxMemory
Maximum memory (in bytes) that this driver is allowed to allocate. So if max. size = 1024x768 (8bpp) and maxBuffers is, say 14. maxMemory = 1024x768x14 = 11010048 bytes (~11MB). Use -1 for unlimited.
priority
The EPICS thread priority for this driver. 0=use asyn default.
stackSize
The size of the stack for the EPICS port thread. 0=use asyn default.
